IRS990.MissionDesc: THE COLORADO SYMPHONY ASSOCIATION (CSA) IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED TO FUND AND OPERATE THE COLORADO SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA FOR THE ENJOYMENT AND BENEFIT OF THE CITIZENS OF METROPOLITAN DENVER AND (CONT'D ON SCHEDULE O)(CONT'D) THE GREATER COLORADO AND ROCKY MOUNTAIN REGIONS. THE COLORADO SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA PERFORMS MORE THAN 100 CLASSICAL, POPS AND FAMILY CONCERTS EACH YEAR; SHOWCASING MANY OF THE WORLD'S FINEST MUSICIANS, CONDUCTORS, AND ENTERTAINERS.
IRS990.Desc: THE COLORADO SYMPHONY ASSOCIATION PERFORMS CONCERTS NORMALLY BENEFITING OVER 250,000 PATRONS FROM THE DENVER AND TRI-STATE AREAS AND PROVIDES A PERFORMANCE PLATFORM TO WORLD-CLASS MUSICIANS.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN ASSETS HELD BY OTHERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PERMANENT ENDOWMENTS CONSIST OF FUNDS HELD BY OTHER TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS ESTABLISHED TO ADMINISTER THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS OF THE SYMPHONY. THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE GOVERNED BY SEPARATE BOARDS OF TRUSTEES. SUPPORTING DISTRIBUTIONS (IF APPLICABLE) FROM THE FUNDS ARE PROVIDED TO THE SYMPHONY FOR PROGRAM SERVICES AND OTHER OPERATIONS. PERMANENT ENDOWMENTS ALSO INCLUDE A BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN AN IRREVOCABLE PERPETUAL TRUST ADMINISTERED BY A COMMUNITY FOUNDATION. THE TRUST AGREEMENT REQUIRES DISTRIBUTION OF 50% OF THE NET INCOME OF THE TRUST TO THE SYMPHONY FOR ITS UNRESTRICTED USE; HOWEVER THE SYMPHONY WILL NEVER RECEIVE THE ASSETS OF THE TRUST.

THE CSA BELIEVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITION TAKEN AFFECTING ITS ANNUAL FILING REQUIREMENTS, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ASSOCIATION WOULD RECOGNIZE FUTURE ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AND LIABILITIES IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE IF SUCH INTEREST AND PENALTIES ARE INCURRED.
CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN ASSETS HELD BY OTHERS -659,626.
PRINCIPAL CONDUCTOR, PETER OUNDJIAN, RECEIVES A HOUSING ALLOWANCE IN LIEU OF PAYING FOR A HOTEL. THE AMOUNT, AS IDENTIFIED IN HIS CONTRACT, IS REPORTED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.
FORMER CEO/CO-CHAIRMAN RECEIVED A SEVERANCE PAYMENT OF $115,385.

THE ORGANIZATION ANNUALLY REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCES OF THE EXECUTIVE STAFF AND OTHER STAFF TO DETERMINE IF ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION IN THE FORM OF BONUSES WILL BE PAID. DURING CALENDAR YEAR ENDING DECEMBER 31, 2021, BONUSES WERE AWARDED BASED ON REVIEW OF EACH INDIVIDUAL'S PERFORMANCE AND SERVICES TO THE ORGANIZATION. DURING FY 2021, MUSICIANS WERE PAID A REDUCED AMOUNT FOR APPROXIMATELY 23 WEEKS IN THE FALL WHEN WE WERE NOT PERFORMING (THOSE WHOSE PERSONAL SERVICES AGREEMENTS INCLUDE OVERSCALE DID NOT RECEIVE IT DURING THAT TIME). IN DECEMBER OF 2021, THE MISSED OVERSCALE WAS PAID.
COLORADO SYMPHONY ASSOCIATION IS REPORTING THE TOTAL NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS IN PART I, COLUMN (B).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: JEROME KERN AND MARY ROSSICK KERN HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A REDACTED COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS SENT FOR REVIEW TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE PRIOR TO FILING. IN ADDITION, A REDACTED COPY OF THE TAX RETURN IS SENT TO THE ENTIRE BOARD FOR REVIEW BEFORE FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLORADO SYMPHONY ASSOCIATION (CSA) HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERING OFFICERS, TRUSTEES, COMMITTEE MEMBERS, MUSICIAN TRUSTEES, STAFF MEMBERS, AND CERTAIN CONSULTANTS (IF APPROPRIATE). EACH RESPONSIBLE PERSON MUST ANNUALLY COMPLETE A DISCLOSURE FORM IDENTIFYING ANY RELATIONSHIPS, POSITIONS, OR CIRCUMSTANCES THAT COULD CONTRIBUTE TO A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE DISCLOSURE FORM MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND HANDLING WHAT IT DETERMINES TO BE ACTUAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST IN THE MANNER DESCRIBED IN THE POLICY UNDER "REVIEWING AND MANAGING CONFLICTS OF INTEREST". IF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OR RESPONSIBLE PERSON BECOMES AWARE THAT CSA IS ABOUT TO ENTER INTO OR MAKE ANY DECISIONS INVOLVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST TRANSACTION WITH THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON, A FAMILY MEMBER, A FRIEND, OR A RELATED ENTITY, THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON MUST: 1) IMMEDIATELY INFORM THOSE CHARGED WITH APPROVING THE TRANSACTION ON BEHALF OF CSA OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST 2) AID THE PERSONS CHARGED WITH MAKING THE DECISION BY DISCLOSING TO SUCH PERSON(S) ANY MATERIAL FACTS THAT BEAR ON THE ADVISABILITY OF THE TRANSACTION FROM THE STANDPOINT OF CSA AND 3) NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE DELIBERATION OR VOTE ON THE DECISION TO ENTER INTO SUCH TRANSACTION, AND NOT ATTEMPT TO EXERT HIS OR HER INFLUENCE WITH RESPECT TO THE MATTER, EITHER AT OR OUTSIDE THE MEETING. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WILL REPORT TO THE BOARD AT ITS NEXT REGULAR MEETING THE RESULTS OF ANY REVIEW AND THE ACTION TAKEN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO (THROUGH SEPTEMBER 2, 2021) WAS BASED ON HIS CONTRACT WHICH WAS DETERMINED AFTER COMPARISON OF SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS AND AFTER ANALYZING THE VALUE BROUGHT TO THE CSA BY THE CEO. AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF BOTH TRUSTEES AND NON-TRUSTEES REVIEWED PERTINENT DATA AND MADE THE COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATION TO THE BOARD WHICH APPROVED THE CEO'S CONTRACT COMPENSATION AMOUNT. A SEVERANCE PAYMENT WAS APPROVED BY THE TRUSTEES IN SEPTEMBER 2021 IN CONNECTION WITH THE CEO'S RESIGNATION. COMPENSATION INCREASES OTHER THAN THE STANDARD PERCENTAGE FOR OTHER SENIOR MANAGEMENT POSITIONS ARE MADE AFTER CONSIDERING AVAILABLE INFORMATION WITH RESPECT TO COMPENSATION PAID TO SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS AND AFTER ANALYZING THE VALUE BROUGHT TO THE CSA BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT STAFF PERSON(S).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST VIA MAIL, EMAIL OR IN PERSON AT ITS OFFICES.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTERESTS IN ASSETS HELD BY OTHERS -659,626.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: RAISE, HOLD & ADMINISTER FUNDS FOR OPERATING NEEDS OF SYMPHONY ASSOCIATION
